019package org.jgrapes.core.internal;
020
021import java.util.ArrayDeque;
022import java.util.HashSet;
023import java.util.Iterator;
024import java.util.Queue;
025import java.util.Set;
026import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedDeque;
027import java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService;
028import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
029import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
030import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
031import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
032
033/**
034 * This class provides the default implementation of an {@link EventPipeline}.
035 */
036public class EventProcessor implements InternalEventPipeline, Runnable {
037
038    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.FieldNamingConventions")
039    protected static final ThreadLocal<EventBase<?>> newEventsParent
040        = new ThreadLocal<>();
041
042    private final ExecutorService executorService;
043    private final ComponentTree componentTree;
044    private final EventPipeline asEventPipeline;
045    protected final Queue<EventChannelsTuple> queue = new ArrayDeque<>();
046    private Iterator<HandlerReference> invoking;
047    // Used by this thread only.
048    private Set<EventBase<?>> suspended = new HashSet<>();
049    // Only this thread can remove, but others might add.
050    private Queue<EventBase<?>> toBeResumed = new ConcurrentLinkedDeque<>();
051    private boolean isExecuting;
052    private ThreadLocal<Thread> executor = new ThreadLocal<>();
053
054    /**
055     * Instantiates a new event processor.
056     *
057     * @param tree the tree
058     */
059    /* default */ EventProcessor(ComponentTree tree) {
060        this(tree, Components.defaultExecutorService());
061    }
062
063    /* default */ EventProcessor(ComponentTree tree,
064            ExecutorService executorService) {
065        this.componentTree = tree;
066        this.executorService = executorService;
067        asEventPipeline = new CheckingPipelineFilter(tree, this);
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * Gets the component tree.
072     *
073     * @return the component tree
074     */
075    protected ComponentTree tree() {
076        return componentTree;
077    }
078
079    /* default */ EventPipeline asEventPipeline() {
080        return asEventPipeline;
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * Called before adding completion events. The parent of
085     * a completion event is not the event that has completed but
086     * the event that generated the original event.
087     *
088     * @param parent the new parent
089     */
090    /* default */ void updateNewEventsParent(EventBase<?> parent) {
091        newEventsParent.set(parent);
092    }
093
094    @Override
095    public <T extends Event<?>> T add(T event, Channel... channels) {
096        ((EventBase<?>) event).generatedBy(newEventsParent.get());
097        ((EventBase<?>) event).processedBy(this);
098        synchronized (this) {
099            EventChannelsTuple.addTo(queue, event, channels);
100            if (isExecuting) {
101                // Processor might be suspended, waiting for events to resume
102                notifyAll();
103            } else {
104                // Queue was initially empty, this starts it
105                GeneratorRegistry.instance().add(this);
106                isExecuting = true;
107                executorService.execute(this);
108            }
109        }
110        return event;
111    }
112
113    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ConfusingTernary")
114    /* default */ void add(Queue<EventChannelsTuple> source) {
115        synchronized (this) {
116            while (true) {
117                EventChannelsTuple entry = source.poll();
118                if (entry == null) {
119                    break;
120                }
121                entry.event.processedBy(this);
122                queue.add(entry);
123            }
124            if (!isExecuting) {
125                GeneratorRegistry.instance().add(this);
126                isExecuting = true;
127                executorService.execute(this);
128            } else {
129                // Processor might be suspended, waiting for events to resume
130                notifyAll();
131            }
132        }
133    }
134
135    @Override
136    public void merge(InternalEventPipeline other) {
137        if (!(other instanceof BufferingEventPipeline)) {
138            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
139                "Can only merge events from an BufferingEventPipeline.");
140        }
141        add(((BufferingEventPipeline) other).retrieveEvents());
142    }
143
144    @Override
145    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidDeeplyNestedIfStmts",
146        "PMD.CognitiveComplexity" })
147    public void run() {
148        String origName = Thread.currentThread().getName();
149        try {
150            Thread.currentThread().setName(
151                origName + " (P" + Components.objectId(this) + ")");
152            executor.set(Thread.currentThread());
153            componentTree.setDispatchingPipeline(this);
154            while (true) {
155                // No lock needed, only this thread can remove from resumed
156                var resumedEvent = toBeResumed.poll();
157                if (resumedEvent != null) {
158                    suspended.remove(resumedEvent);
159                    resumedEvent.invokeWhenResumed();
160                    invokeHandlers(resumedEvent.clearSuspendedHandlers(),
161                        resumedEvent);
162                    continue;
163                }
164
165                EventChannelsTuple next;
166                synchronized (this) {
167                    next = queue.poll();
168                    // If empty, make sure there are none suspended
169                    if (next == null) {
170                        if (suspended.isEmpty()) {
171                            // Everything is done
172                            GeneratorRegistry.instance().remove(this);
173                            isExecuting = false;
174                            synchronized (executor) {
175                                executor.notifyAll();
176                            }
177                            break;
178                        }
179                        try {
180                            // Wait for something to do
181                            wait();
182                        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
183                            // Ignore
184                        }
185                        continue;
186                    }
187                }
188                HandlerList handlers
189                    = componentTree.getEventHandlers(next.event, next.channels);
190                invokeHandlers(handlers.iterator(), next.event);
191            }
192        } finally {
193            newEventsParent.set(null);
194            componentTree.setDispatchingPipeline(null);
195            executor.set(null);
196            Thread.currentThread().setName(origName);
197        }
198    }
199
200    /**
201     * Invoke all (remaining) handlers with the given event as parameter.
202     *
203     * @param handlers the handlers
204     * @param event the event
205     */
206    private void invokeHandlers(Iterator<HandlerReference> handlers,
207            EventBase<?> event) {
208        try {
209            invoking = handlers;
210            newEventsParent.set(event);
211            // invoking may be set to null by suspendHandling()
212            while (invoking != null && invoking.hasNext()) {
213                HandlerReference hdlr = invoking.next();
214                try {
215                    hdlr.invoke(event);
216                    if (event.isStopped()) {
217                        break;
218                    }
219                } catch (AssertionError t) {
220                    // JUnit support
221                    CoreUtils.setAssertionError(t);
222                    event.handlingError(asEventPipeline, t);
223                } catch (Error e) { // NOPMD
224                    // Wouldn't have caught it, if it was possible.
225                    throw e;
226                } catch (Throwable t) { // NOPMD
227                    // Errors have been rethrown, so this should work.
228                    event.handlingError(asEventPipeline, t);
229                }
230            }
231        } catch (AssertionError t) {
232            // JUnit support
233            CoreUtils.setAssertionError(t);
234            event.handlingError(asEventPipeline, t);
235        } catch (Error e) { // NOPMD
236            // Wouldn't have caught it, if it was possible.
237            throw e;
238        } catch (Throwable t) { // NOPMD
239            // Errors have been rethrown, so this should work.
240            event.handlingError(asEventPipeline, t);
241        } finally { // NOPMD
242            if (invoking != null) {
243                event.handled();
244                invoking = null;
245                newEventsParent.get().decrementOpen();
246            }
247        }
248    }
249
250    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CompareObjectsWithEquals")
251    /* default */ void suspendHandling(EventBase<?> event) {
252        if (Thread.currentThread() != executor.get()) {
253            throw new IllegalStateException("May only be called from handler.");
254        }
255        if (!invoking.hasNext()) {
256            // Last anyway, nothing to be done
257            return;
258        }
259        event.setSuspendedHandlers(invoking);
260        invoking = null;
261        suspended.add(event);
262        // Just in case (might happen)
263        toBeResumed.remove(event);
264    }
265
266    /* default */ void resumeHandling(EventBase<?> event) {
267        toBeResumed.add(event);
268        synchronized (this) {
269            notifyAll();
270        }
271    }
272
273    /*
274     * (non-Javadoc)
275     * 
276     * @see org.jgrapes.core.internal.InternalEventPipeline#executorService()
277     */
278    @Override
279    public ExecutorService executorService() {
280        return executorService;
281    }
282
283    @Override
284    public void awaitExhaustion() throws InterruptedException {
285        synchronized (executor) {
286            while (isExecuting) {
287                executor.wait();
288            }
289        }
290    }
291
292    /*
293     * (non-Javadoc)
294     * 
295     * @see java.lang.Object#toString()
296     */
297    @Override
298    public String toString() {
299        StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
300        builder.append(Components.objectName(this))
301            .append(" [");
302        if (queue != null) {
303            builder.append("queue=")
304                .append(queue);
305        }
306        builder.append(']');
307        return builder.toString();
308    }
309
310}
